quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Singer and Group
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, country, shouldve. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This singer wrote and recorded the song Sunshine Superman, which reached #1 in 1966?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Donovan

questions.question: This group flew up the charts in 1975 with the #1 song Listen to What the Man Said.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney  Wings

questions.question: Which singer performed the hit  To Sir With Love that reached  #1 in 1967?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: LuLu

questions.question: This alternative rap band had a #11 pop single in 1990 with Humpty Dance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Digital Underground

questions.question: Which group recorded the massive 1991 hit O.P.P?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Naughty by Nature

questions.question: Which singer had a #1 hit in 1987 with Got My Mind Set On You ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Harrison

questions.question: Which band had a #3 hit in 1999 with Every Morning?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sugar Ray

questions.question: This singer was Thanking God That He Was a Country Boy  in the year 1975. He was probably also thanking God for this song reaching  #1 on the charts. What singer are we talking about?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Denver

questions.question: What group had a #4 hit in 1981 with the single Shake It Up?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cars

questions.question: What group was singing about Black Water in the year 1975?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Doobie Brothers

questions.question: This group recorded I Ran (So Far Away), which became a #9 hit in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Flock of Seagulls

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frankie Valli

questions.question: This singer had a #3 hit in 1987 with  Shouldve Known Better, who is this singer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Marx

questions.question: What singer recorded She Blinded Me With Science, a song which became a #5 hit in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Dolby

questions.question: What group had a monster hit during the Summer of Love with Carrie Anne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hollies

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, festival, midnight. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This group had a #1 hit in 1973 hit with the song Wildflower.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skylark

questions.question: At a 1969 rock festival, the outlaw motorcycle group Hells Angels were hired to provide security. A riot broke during the festival and Hells Angles beat up the crowd, which resulted in multiple injuries and four deaths. Where was this famous event held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Altamont Raceway Park

questions.question: This group was singing about a Midnight Train to Georgia. The song sped up the tracks and stayed in the #1 position for 2 straight weeks in 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gladys Knight  The Pips

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bette Midler

questions.question: What singer was asking us if we happened to see The Most Beautiful Girl in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie Rich

questions.question: In 1977, four members of American Southern rock band Lynyrd Skynyrd were killed in a plane crash on their way to a concert in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The 1968 song Sympathy for the Devil by the Rolling Stones presents an image of a sophisticated Lucifer and his influences on the world throughout history. The song makes several references to historical events. Which of the following is not an event referenced in the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The American Civil War

questions.question: Which of the following is not a name used by Creedence Clearwater Revival, a band founded by John Fogerty, Doug Clifford, Stu Cook and Tom Fogerty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hour Glass

questions.question: This band wanted you to Pick up the Pieces in 1975.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Average White Band

questions.question: This British rock band, known for smashing their instruments at the end of their concerts, recorded the rock opera Tommy in 1969.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Who

questions.question: This group was Reelin in the Years and stowing away the time in 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steely Dan

questions.question: In 1973, this singer was driving in the Right Place but it must have been the Wrong Time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. John

questions.question: What singer was telling us about The Night the Lights Went Out in Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vicki Lawrence

questions.question: In 1973 Bob Marley released I Shot the Sheriff, a song about injustice and defiance. What was the alternative title of the song, which Marley initially intended to use?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Shot the Police

questions.question: This singer recorded Killing Me Softly with His Song in 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roberta Flack

at the Ontario Motor Speedway in Ontario, California
